element.name: Irish Pirates by Windsockers, Unknown Cache (4/2.5)

long-description.p:
Luke Ryan was born in Rush in 1750. At an early age he Immigrated to France and obtained a commission as a lieutenant in Dillon’s Irish Regiment. After some time he returned to Rush and Began operating as a smuggler between Ireland and France. Between 1775 and 1783 France sympathized with the Americans during the War Of Independence, and the French government commissioned Ryan as the Commander of a privateer, The Black Prince. For several years he Plundered English ships around the English coast. Unfortunately, His nest egg, some £70,000 which he had amassed from smuggling and Privateering, was appropriated by French bankers.
Early in 1782 English forces captured Ryan aboard the Cologne. A Short time later, on 30th. Of March, he was convicted in the Old Bailey in London on charges of piracy, smuggling and treason, and Condemned to death. Ryan led a charmed life, however. Ordered to The gallows four times, four times he was reprieved. At the Conclusion of the war, the French intervened on his behalf and Secured his release.
In stark contrast to his colorful and exciting younger days, Luke Ryan died in the King’s Bench debtors Prison in 1789, where he Had been detained for a debt of £200.

p.b:
Please do not attempt to drive beyond the marked signs.
The sand is very soft in this area and care needs to be taken when retrieving the information for this cache.
Please watch out for the Muggles
It would be a good idea to bring your own pen.For Woar Wars and part of this cache you made need good boots.
Also for Woar Wars careful note needs to be taken of the tides.

long-description.p: To find the cache you will need to collect some information from various locations.
Using the information captured from Woar Wars the corresponding numbers from Luke’s name etc will help with the coordinates for Part two of this cache.
On the board at these coordinates Colmcille visited in the ? Century. Call that number X.
The letter E should be "pointedly" visible here. Call the amount of times it is visible "A". The coordinates for part 3 are N53 30.68(A+1) W006 06 3A8.
You will find part of the final coordinates here and the coordinates for the next stage.

Here you will see a year.
To calculate the next stage convert the year to ABCD. The coordinates for the next stage will be N53 30.(A+C)(C+D)A W006 07.A(A+C)0
Here you will find the rest of the final coordinates.

element.encoded-hints: 2. Fore. 3. Body armour would help.4.Messing around in boats.

ul.li:
2009-05-29T19:00:00Z : Found it by Fjon
Phew! Finally did it. I can't remember when I started this, it was well over a year ago. Every time I was around Rush I would have a go at whatever stage I was at, and eventually I made it through them all. Stage 3 had me stumped for a long time - as everyone else has said it's not an easy one. Stage 5 also took a few visits, and it's not quite as accessible as it was at one stage. It felt nice having the final cache in my hands finally. Everything is in very good condition considering it's been lying there a year.

2008-07-19T19:00:00Z : Write note by snoopyandmickey
part completed. I ran out of time. Hope to get back next week or the week after. Phew!

2008-06-14T19:00:00Z : Found it by toczygroszek
Congratulations Dara! I was here about 6 pm, only 1 hour later! Sand clock inside was still running :) I thought you took token, but it wasn't here, hmmm... At stage 3 I spent nearly 6 hours!!! Two dogs helped me - we three together on 4 legs were running in bushes. I didn't know dogs names, but I called them Rush & Lusk [:D] Why it was so long? I was searching in wrong place! I took wrong numbers from stage 2 - life is hard and full of... thorns. Anyway - final cache is done, but it took me all day. Thanks Mr Windsocker for this experience.
[This entry was edited by toczygroszek on Saturday, June 21, 2008 at 4:41:27 AM.]

2008-06-14T19:00:00Z : Found it by daraconn
At last! It took weeks, 5 visits to the area, and hours of searching, but my obsessive determination was rewarded with a find at 5 p.m. this afternoon after a short walk and a brief search.
Unfortunately, the TB "Jagged Metal Token" is not in the cache.

2008-06-10T19:00:00Z : Write note by daraconn
Nearly there - on my third visit to stage 5 I was finally able to get the co-ordinates for the final stage.

wpt.name: GCWBW1
wpt.desc: Irish Pirates by Windsockers, Unknown Cache (4/2.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Irish Pirates
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Luke Ryan

Luke Ryan was born in Rush in 1750. At an early age he Immigrated to France and obtained a commission as a lieutenant in Dillon’s Irish Regiment. After some time he returned to Rush and Began operating as a smuggler between Ireland and France. Between 1775 and 1783 France sympathized with the Americans during the War Of Independence, and the French government commissioned Ryan as the Commander of a privateer, The Black Prince. For several years he Plundered English ships around the English coast. Unfortunately, His nest egg, some £70,000 which he had amassed from smuggling and Privateering, was appropriated by French bankers.
Early in 1782 English forces captured Ryan aboard the Cologne. A Short time later, on 30th. Of March, he was convicted in the Old Bailey in London on charges of piracy, smuggling and treason, and Condemned to death. Ryan led a charmed life, however. Ordered to The gallows four times, four times he was reprieved. At the Conclusion of the war, the French intervened on his behalf and Secured his release.
In stark contrast to his colorful and exciting younger days, Luke Ryan died in the King’s Bench debtors Prison in 1789, where he Had been detained for a debt of £200.


Warning

Please do not attempt to drive beyond the marked signs.
The sand is very soft in this area and care needs to be taken when retrieving the information for this cache.
Please watch out for the Muggles
It would be a good idea to bring your own pen.For Woar Wars and part of this cache you made need good boots.
Also for Woar Wars careful note needs to be taken of the tides.


The Cache

To find the cache you will need to collect some information from various locations.

Part One:

Using the information captured from Woar Wars the corresponding numbers from Luke’s name etc will help with the coordinates for Part two of this cache.

On the board at these coordinates Colmcille visited in the ? Century. Call that number X.


The coordinates are “N53 U0.H0G W00X 0X.(U-K)XL.


Part Two:

The letter E should be "pointedly" visible here. Call the amount of times it is visible "A". The coordinates for part 3 are N53 30.68(A+1) W006 06 3A8.


Part Three:

You will find part of the final coordinates here and the coordinates for the next stage.


Part Four:

Here you will see a year.
To calculate the next stage convert the year to ABCD. The coordinates for the next stage will be N53 30.(A+C)(C+D)A W006 07.A(A+C)0


Part Five:

Here you will find the rest of the final coordinates.


Final

?



The Windsockers

Additional Waypoints

FLWBW1 - Final Location
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___

S2WBW1 - Stage 2
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___

S3WBW1 - Stage 3
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___

S4WBW1 - Stage 4
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___

S5WBW1 - Stage 5
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___

S6WBW1 - Stage 6
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:encoded_hints: 2. Fore. 3. Body armour would help.4.Messing around in boats.

Stage 3 had me stumped for a long time - as everyone else has said it's not an easy one. Stage 5 also took a few visits, and it's not quite as accessible as it was at one stage. It felt nice having the final cache in my hands finally. Everything is in very good condition considering it's been lying there a year.

Two dogs helped me - we three together on 4 legs were running in bushes. I didn't know dogs names, but I called them Rush & Lusk [:D] Why it was so long? I was searching in wrong place! I took wrong numbers from stage 2 - life is hard and full of... thorns. Anyway - final cache is done, but it took me all day. Thanks Mr Windsocker for this experience.

At last! It took weeks, 5 visits to the area, and hours of searching, but my obsessive determination was rewarded with a find at 5 p.m. this afternoon after a short walk and a brief search.
Unfortunately, the TB "Jagged Metal Token" is not in the cache.
Nearly there - on my third visit to stage 5 I was finally able to get the co-ordinates for the final stage.
